Actions
  • Claws: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Inflicts 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.
  • Illusory Appearance: The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies., The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC20 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.
  • Invisible Passage: The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her TAG:status ends (as if TAG:status on a spell). While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is invisible with her.

A Stone Golem.raw_value:
Hex E3 in Vicious Crags (The Lands of Vo'il)

Field of Boulders > > The Lands of Vo'il > Vicious Crags > Hex E3

Multiple plateaus separated by seemingly bottomless chasms are connected with fragile rope bridges. The strong wind swings the brides from side to side, making crossing them a terrifying experience.

A field of carved boulders stretches near the base of the tallest mountain. like an abandoned sculpture garden. Each rock has been carved into a face, the features exaggerated and distorted like a disturbing reflection.

A Stone Golem wanders the boulder field, ambushing those who come to investigate.

CR: 10 (5900 XP)
AC: 17 (natural armor)
HP: (17d10 + 85)
Speed: Walk 30 ft.
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
22 +6 9 -1 20 +5 3 -4 11 +1 1 -5
  • Immunities: poison and psychic; bludgeoning, piercing and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
  • Senses: darkvision 120 ft.
  • Languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
  • Immutable Form: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.
  • Magic Resistance: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
  • Magic Weapons: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.
Actions
  • Multiattack: The golem makes two slam attacks.
  • Slam: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Inflicts 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.
  • Slow : The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

5-9 Snowy
10-11 Fog & Frost
12 Freezing
† There's a 1-in-6 chance once a day for an avalanche

Imps.raw_value:
Cave area #27 in Bowel of the Raging Pits

Cave Dig > > Bowel of the Raging Pits > Area # 27

Foreshadowing
  • A successful listening roll could detect the sounds that the Imps are making inside this area.
Description
The air in this area is dense and misty and the stalagmites have a few mossy patches on them. A weird sensation is creeping up your spine.
  • There are 2 Imps inside. They will attack anyone stepping in.

    Imp

    CR: 1 (200 XP)
    AC: 13
    HP: (3d4 + 3)
    Speed: Walk 20 ft. Fly 40 ft.
    STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
    6 -2 17 +4 13 +2 11 +1 12 +1 14 +2
    • Immunities: fire and poison
    • Senses: darkvision 120 ft.
    • Alignment: Lawful Evil
    • Languages: Infernal, Common
    • Shapechanger: The imp can use its action to polymorph into a beast form that resembles a rat (speed 20 ft.), a raven (20 ft., fly 60 ft.), or a spider (20 ft., climb 20 ft.), or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
    • Devil's Sight: Magical darkness doesn't impede the imp's darkvision.
    • Magic Resistance: The imp has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
    Actions
    • Sting (Bite in Beast Form): +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Inflicts 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC11 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
    • Invisibility: The imp magically turns invisible until it attacks, or until its TAG:status ends (as if TAG:status on a spell). Any equipment the imp wears or carries is invisible with it.
    • Monster Hoard:
      • 179 gp in coins
      • 100 gp worth of gemstones (50gp each): Sardonyx, Citrine

  • There’s also a figure made of sticks and twine near the wall on the far end and some dry remains of food next to it.
  • A wooden barrel contains Electa of Dokar’s from Balaal decorated axe (actually an Axe +2 )

  • There’s a Flesh Golem inside. It will attack anyone stepping in.

    Flesh Golem

    CR: 5 (1800 XP)
    AC: 9
    HP: (11d8 + 44)
    Speed: Walk 30 ft.
    STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
    19 +5 9 -1 18 +4 6 -2 10 5 -3
    • Immunities: lightning and poison; bludgeoning, piercing and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
    • Senses: darkvision 60 ft.
    • Alignment: Neutral
    • Languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
    • Berserk: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points., The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a DC15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.
    • Aversion of Fire: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.
    • Immutable Form: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.
    • Lightning Absorption: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.
    • Magic Resistance: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
    • Magic Weapons: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.
    Actions
    • Multiattack: The golem makes two slam attacks.
    • Slam: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Inflicts 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.
    • Monster Hoard:
      • 4,708 gp in coins

The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a DC15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.
    • Aversion of Fire: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.
    • Immutable Form: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.
    • Lightning Absorption: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.
    • Magic Resistance: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
    • Magic Weapons: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

Tarrasque

CR: 30 (155000 XP)
AC: 25 (natural armor)
HP: (33d20 + 330)
Speed: Walk 40 ft.
STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
30 +10 11 +1 30 +10 3 -4 11 +1 11 +1
  • Saving Throws: Wis +9, Cha +9, Int +5
  • Immunities: fire and poison; bludgeoning, piercing and slashing from nonmagical attacks
  • Senses: blindsight 120 ft.
  • Legendary Resistance (3/Day): If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
  • Magic Resistance: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
  • Reflective Carapace: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a TAG:spell spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.
  • Siege Monster: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.
Actions
  • Multiattack: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.
  • Bite: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Inflicts 36 (4d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.
  • Claw: +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Inflicts 28 (4d8 + 10) slashing damage.
  • Horns: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Inflicts 32 (4d10 + 10) piercing damage.
  • Tail: +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Inflicts 24 (4d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC20 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
  • Frightful Presence: Each creature of the tarrasque's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a DC17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.
  • Swallow: The tarrasque makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has TAG:quickref against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 (16d6) acid damage at the start of each of the tarrasque's turns., If the tarrasque takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a DC20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque. If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting prone.
  • Lair hoard (1-in-6 base chance of finding if an encounter occured, or a succesfull DC18 Investigation check):
    • 273,000 gp in coins
    • 35,000 gp worth of gemstones (5000gp each): 2 × Black sapphire, 3 × Diamond, Ruby, Jacinth
    • Magic Items: Apparatus of Kwalish, Ioun stone (greater absorption), Iron flask

  • Horrifying Visage: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the ghost that can see it must succeed on a DC13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages 1d4 × 10 years. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this ghost's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a TAG:spell spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.
  • Possession : One humanoid that the ghost can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC13 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the ghost; the ghost then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies., The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the TAG:spell spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

Description
An oversized wooden coffin was smashed to pieces here and the entryway is blackened. You see glowing eyes staring at you from inside.
  • There are 3 Werewolfs inside. They will attack anyone stepping in.

    Werewolf

    CR: 3 (700 XP)
    AC: 11in humanoid form,12 (natural armor)in wolf or hybrid form
    HP: (9d8 + 18)
    Speed: Walk 30 ft. (40 ft. in wolf form)
    STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
    15 +3 13 +2 14 +2 10 11 +1 10
    • Immunities: ; bludgeoning, piercing and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
    • Alignment: Chaotic Evil
    • Languages: Common (can't speak in wolf form)
    • Shapechanger: The werewolf can use its action to polymorph into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a wolf, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
    • Keen Hearing and Smell: The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
    Actions
    • Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only): The werewolf makes two attacks: two with its spear (humanoid form) or one with its bite and one with its claws (hybrid form).
    • Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only): +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Inflicts 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC12 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.
    • Claws (Hybrid Form Only): +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Inflicts 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.
    • Spear (Humanoid Form Only): +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Inflicts 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.
    • Monster Hoard:
      • 155 gp in coins
      • 110 gp worth of gemstones (10gp each): Obsidian, Hematite, 2 × Lapis lazuli, Turquoise, Rhodochrosite, Azurite, 2 × Malachite, Moss agate, Banded agate

If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the cloaker's moan for the next 24 hours.
    • Phantasms (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest): The cloaker magically creates three illusory duplicates of itself if it isn't in bright light. The duplicates move with it and mimic its actions, shifting position so as to make it impossible to track which cloaker is the real one. If the cloaker is ever in an area of bright light, the duplicates disappear., Whenever any creature targets the cloaker with an attack or a harmful spell while a duplicate remains, that creature rolls randomly to determine whether it targets the cloaker or one of the duplicates. A creature is unaffected by this magical effect if it can't see or if it relies on senses other than sight., A duplicate has the cloaker's AC and uses its saving throws. If an attack hits a duplicate, or if a duplicate fails a saving throw against an effect that deals damage, the duplicate disappears.

The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies., The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the TAG:spell spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

      • 200 gp worth of artifacts (25gp each): Carved bone statuette, Cloth-of-gold vestments, Copper chalice with silver filigree, 2 × Gold locket with a painted portrait inside, Pair of engraved bone dice, 2 × Small mirror set in a painted wooden frame

  • There are also many shoes and boots, piled together in the far corner and some shattered pieces of glass next to it.

The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

Description
It is dark and damp here and the hidden alcoves are covered with spots of yellow ooze. There are some big jars near the far wall.
  • The jars are trapped. There's a small gas-filled vial made of an extremely fragile glass embedded in a handle. If undetected using a DC16 Wisdom (Perception, passive or active) check, it will pop open. Succeed a DC20 Constitution saving throw or sustain 1d6 turns of uncontrolled spasms.
  • There’s a 2-in-6 chance the jars contain:
    • 207 gp in coins
    • 20 gp worth of gemstones (10gp each): Turquoise, Blue quartz
    Otherwise, this place was already looted earlier.
  • There’s also a pile of papers near the wall on the left and some carved figurines next to it.
  • Searching will uncover an old leather pouch holding the key (🜂) to unlock the arched bronze door (to the W) in area 79

If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a DC11 Dexterity saving throw to avoid the rust monster's touch., If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, it takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

The song ends if the harpy is incapacitated., While charmed by the harpy, a target is incapacitated and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the charmed target is more than 5 feet away from the harpy, the target must move on its turn toward the harpy by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the harpy, a target can repeat the saving throw. A creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it., A target that successfully saves is immune to this harpy's song for the next 24 hours.

Hex E4S31 in Black Shield Timberlands (The Lands of Vo'il)

Abandoned Cart > > The Lands of Vo'il > Black Shield Timberlands > Hex E4S31

Carved into the base of a titanic tree, the Citadel of Hoviir is a truly breath-taking sight. Banners of woven vines decorate the towers, and guards clad in polished emerald armour patrol the battlements.

A rickety wooden cart idles next to a clearing. Inside the cart there are several crates marked with a strange symbol, including one crate with its lid ajar. Within the crate, nestled amongst the straw packing, are several multi-coloured potions. The bottles are unlabelled.

  • Horrifying Visage: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the ghost that can see it must succeed on a DC13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages 1d4 × 10 years. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this ghost's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a TAG:spell spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.
  • Possession : One humanoid that the ghost can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC13 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the ghost; the ghost then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies., The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the TAG:spell spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

    Vampire

    CR: 13 (10000 XP)
    AC: 16 (natural armor)
    HP: (17d8 + 68)
    Speed: Walk 30 ft.
    STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
    18 +4 18 +4 18 +4 17 +4 15 +3 18 +4
    • Saving Throws: Dex +9, Wis +7, Cha +9
    • Senses: darkvision 120 ft.
    • Alignment: Lawful Evil
    • Languages: the languages it knew in life
    • Shapechanger: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form., While in bat form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies., While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.
    • Legendary Resistance (3/Day): If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
    • Misty Escape: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling unconscious, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed., While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.
    • Regeneration: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.
    • Spider Climb: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
    • Vampire Weaknesses: The vampire has the following flaws:, TAG:i The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants., TAG:i The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water., TAG:i If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is paralyzed until the stake is removed., TAG:i The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
    Actions
    • Multiattack (Vampire Form Only): The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.
    • Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only): +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Inflicts 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC18).
    • Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only): +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Inflicts 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a TAG:creature under the vampire's control.
    • Charm: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a DC17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be charmed by the vampire. The charmed target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack., Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.
    • Children of the Night (1/Day): The vampire magically calls 2d4 swarms of TAG:creature or TAG:creature, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, the vampire can call 3d6 TAG:creature instead. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.
    • Monster Hoard:
      • 27,000 gp in coins
      • 3,750 gp worth of artifacts (750gp each): 2 × Bottle stopper cork embossed with gold leaf and set with amethysts, 2 × Carved harp of exotic wood with ivory inlay and zircon gems, Small gold idol

Dungeon area #29 in Crypt of the Corrupted Order

Ceremonial Chamber > > Crypt of the Corrupted Order > Area # 29

Doorways
  • E side - arched bronze door (Barricaded)
  • S side - round iron door (Barricaded)
  • N side - passage to area 35.
Description
A decorated ceremonial stone was placed here and the ground is covered with spots of yellow ooze. You spot something quite big lying on the floor.
  • Lying on the floor is the dust covered skeleton of a goblin. Searching it will uncover:
    • 67 gp in coins
    • Rope (50’) (Usable)
    • Shortbow (Usable)
  • There are also many candles, burnt out in a pile of wax in an alcove and some damp leaves next to it.
  • There’s a pressure plate lever that can open the secret door in area 20 (to the W)
  • A stone-carved demon face on the wall with a large gaping mouth is a magical portal. Anyone stepping into the portal will be magically teleported into area 28.

Dungeon area #23 in Crypt of the Corrupted Order

Shrine > > Crypt of the Corrupted Order > Area # 23

Doorways
  • E side - passage to area 32.
  • N side - passage to area 29.
Description
Countless humanoid skulls “decorate” the boundaries and the corner sides have a few spots of green rot on them. There’s also a colourful glow emitting from the ground.
  • Countless green and purple bioluminescent mushrooms are growing from cracks in the ground. Anyone consuming them might be severely poisoned (1d4 of damage until a successful saving throw per turn).
  • Marbles litter the area.
  • A stone-carved demon face on the wall with a large gaping mouth is a magical portal. Anyone stepping into the portal will be magically teleported into area 9.

An ice-cold breeze can be felt in the passage here.

There's an acidic vapour trap here. When undetected using a DC17 Wisdom (Perception, passive or active) check, it will trigger if stepping through its trip wire, causing a spray of acid to come out of a hole in the wall. Succeed a DC20 Dexterity saving throw or sustain 1d6 damage by acid.

If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.

    Actions
    • Bite: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Inflicts 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the target is unconscious. Another creature can use an action to shake the target awake.
    • Constrict: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Inflicts 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the couatl can't constrict another target.
    • Change Shape: The couatl magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the couatl's choice)., In a new form, the couatl retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and other actions are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. If the new form has a bite attack, the couatl can use its bite in that form.
    • Monster Hoard:

  • Claw: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Inflicts 15 (2d6 + 8) slashing damage.
  • Tail: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Inflicts 17 (2d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.
  • Frightful Presence: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC21 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.
  • Breath Weapons : The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons., (a) Fire Breath - The dragon exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one., (a) Weakening Breath - The dragon exhales gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC21 Strength saving throw or have disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength checks, and Strength saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
  • Change Shape: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice)., In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.
  • Lair hoard (1-in-6 base chance of finding if an encounter occured, or a succesfull DC18 Investigation check):
    • 224,000 gp in coins
    • 30,000 gp worth of artifacts (7500gp each): Gold cup set with emeralds, Gold jewelry box with platinum filigree, Jade game board with solid gold playing pieces, Jeweled platinum ring

The ghost now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies., The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the TAG:spell spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies., The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the TAG:spell spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

Description

  • Ka'zaath the Vampire is inside this area. It will attack anyone stepping in.

    Vampire

    CR: 13 (10000 XP)
    AC: 16 (natural armor)
    HP: (17d8 + 68)
    Speed: Walk 30 ft.
    STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
    18 +4 18 +4 18 +4 17 +4 15 +3 18 +4
    • Saving Throws: Dex +9, Wis +7, Cha +9
    • Senses: darkvision 120 ft.
    • Alignment: Lawful Evil
    • Languages: the languages it knew in life
    • Shapechanger: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form., While in bat form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies., While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.
    • Legendary Resistance (3/Day): If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
    • Misty Escape: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling unconscious, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed., While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.
    • Regeneration: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.
    • Spider Climb: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
    • Vampire Weaknesses: The vampire has the following flaws:, TAG:i The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants., TAG:i The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water., TAG:i If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is paralyzed until the stake is removed., TAG:i The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
    Actions
    • Multiattack (Vampire Form Only): The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.
    • Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only): +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Inflicts 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC18).
    • Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only): +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Inflicts 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a TAG:creature under the vampire's control.
    • Charm: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a DC17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be charmed by the vampire. The charmed target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack., Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.
    • Children of the Night (1/Day): The vampire magically calls 2d4 swarms of TAG:creature or TAG:creature, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, the vampire can call 3d6 TAG:creature instead. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.
    • Monster Hoard:
      • 31,000 gp in coins
      • 8,000 gp worth of gemstones (500gp each): 3 × Black pearl, Alexandrite, 5 × Blue spinel, 2 × Topaz, 3 × Aquamarine, 2 × Peridot

  • A stained old full-size mirror on the wall is a magical portal. Anyone stepping into the portal will be magically teleported into area 13.

  • Keen Hearing and Smell: The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
Actions
  • Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only): The werewolf makes two attacks: two with its spear (humanoid form) or one with its bite and one with its claws (hybrid form).

  • Claws (Hybrid Form Only): +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Inflicts 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.
  • Spear (Humanoid Form Only): +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Inflicts 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

The target must succeed on a DC10 Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the will-o'-wisp regains 10 (3d6) hit points.
  • Ephemeral: The will-o'-wisp can't wear or carry anything.
  • Incorporeal Movement: The will-o'-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were TAG:quickref. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
  • Variable Illumination: The will-o'-wisp sheds bright light in a 5 to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of ft. equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.
Actions
  • Shock: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Inflicts 9 (2d8) lightning damage.
  • Invisibility: The will-o'-wisp and its light magically become invisible until it attacks or uses its Consume Life, or until its TAG:status ends (as if TAG:status on a spell).

Dungeon area #21 in Crypt of the Violent Ogre

Crypt > > Crypt of the Violent Ogre > Area # 21

Foreshadowing
  • It is impossible to hear anything inside.
Doorways
  • W side - secret door (requiring a passphrase)
    • If detected, one of the characters will uncontrollably gesture or act the word "Dreaded". The full passphrase is in area 50. Gesture or mime the complete passphrase to open.
Description
Countless creepy crawlies all over rush back into the darkness and the entryway has a few rusty stains on it. You feel the chill of death curling up your spine.
  • There’s a Specter inside. It will attack anyone stepping in.

    AC: 12

Dungeon area #32 in Crypt of the Violent Ogre

Crypt > > Crypt of the Violent Ogre > Area # 32

Doorways
  • W side - rectangular wooden door (Locked 🜐)
    • The key is in area 35
  • N side - arched wooden door (Stuck)
  • S side - secret door (requiring a passphrase)
    • If detected, a carving on the wall will spell "Dead". The full passphrase is in area 59. Carve and complete the phrase to open.
Description
Countless creepy crawlies all over rush back into the darkness and the hidden alcoves are slick with slime. Faint colourful light is emitting from everywhere.
  • A few blue, red and yellow bioluminescent mushrooms are growing from cracks in the ground. Anyone consuming them will be paralyzed with mind twisting hallucinations for 1d6 turns.
  • There’s also a bouquet of flowers in a large basin and some ripped pieces of old rope next to it.
  • A stone-carved demon face on the wall with a large gaping mouth is a magical portal. Anyone stepping into the portal will be magically teleported into area 66.

If the target can see the mummy, it must succeed on a DC11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.

ghostly pendulum.raw_value:
Hex E7S37 in Heartseeker Forest (The Lands of Vo'il)

Spectral Pendulum > > The Lands of Vo'il > Heartseeker Forest > Hex E7S37

An oversized statue of a warrior holding a sword against the ground stands proudly in a clearing here. Fresh flowers were recently placed near its base.

The spectral form of a towering, ghostly pendulum swings with a vicious rhythm next to a clearing. Beneath the deadly apparition the fresh corpse of a Will-o'-Wisp lies in two, bisected by the umbral blade.

Hex E8S39 in Goldenswan Timberlands (The Lands of Vo'il)

Will-o'-Wisps > > The Lands of Vo'il > Goldenswan Timberlands > Hex E8S39

Dead trees rise from the dry soil like headstones, each one a crumbling reminder of the devastation once wrought here. Life seems absent, and a heavy silence blankets the land.

5 Will-o'-Wisps are foraging where the woods meet a large hill.

There’s a 2-in-6 chance of encountering at least some of them outside (the rest will be in their lair inside a well-hidden cave).

Speed: Walk 0 ft. Fly 50 ft. (hover)

1 -5 28 +9 10 13 +2 14 +2 11 +1

  • Consume Life: As a bonus action, the will-o'-wisp can target one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a DC10 Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the will-o'-wisp regains 10 (3d6) hit points.
  • Ephemeral: The will-o'-wisp can't wear or carry anything.
  • Incorporeal Movement: The will-o'-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were TAG:quickref. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
  • Variable Illumination: The will-o'-wisp sheds bright light in a 5 to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of ft. equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.
Actions

The ghost now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies., The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the TAG:spell spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

Description

  • Kalaris the Vampire is inside this area. It will attack anyone stepping in.

    Vampire

    CR: 13 (10000 XP)
    AC: 16 (natural armor)
    HP: (17d8 + 68)
    Speed: Walk 30 ft.
    STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
    18 +4 18 +4 18 +4 17 +4 15 +3 18 +4
    • Saving Throws: Dex +9, Wis +7, Cha +9
    • Senses: darkvision 120 ft.
    • Alignment: Lawful Evil
    • Languages: the languages it knew in life
    • Shapechanger: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form., While in bat form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies., While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.
    • Legendary Resistance (3/Day): If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
    • Misty Escape: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling unconscious, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed., While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.
    • Regeneration: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.
    • Spider Climb: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
    • Vampire Weaknesses: The vampire has the following flaws:, TAG:i The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants., TAG:i The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water., TAG:i If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is paralyzed until the stake is removed., TAG:i The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
    Actions
    • Multiattack (Vampire Form Only): The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.
    • Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only): +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Inflicts 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC18).
    • Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only): +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Inflicts 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a TAG:creature under the vampire's control.
    • Charm: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a DC17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be charmed by the vampire. The charmed target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack., Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.
    • Children of the Night (1/Day): The vampire magically calls 2d4 swarms of TAG:creature or TAG:creature, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, the vampire can call 3d6 TAG:creature instead. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.
    • Monster Hoard:
      • 32,000 gp in coins
      • 1,500 gp worth of artifacts (750gp each): 2 × Carved harp of exotic wood with ivory inlay and zircon gems
      • Magic Items: Potion of invulnerability, Potion of superior healing

Dungeon area #6 in Crypt of the Unholy Goblin

Library > > Crypt of the Unholy Goblin > Area # 6

Foreshadowing
  • It is impossible to hear anything inside.
Doorways
  • N side - secret door (requiring a passphrase)
    • If detected, a gentle voice will sing "Forbidden". The full passphrase is in area 17. Sing or use the phrase in a song to open.
  • S side - passage to area 8.
Description
There are numerous scroll storage cavities and the ground has some patches of dampness on it. Looking down, you realize you just stepped into a pool of blood.
  • There are 4 Will-o'-Wisps inside. They will attack anyone stepping in.

    Will-o'-Wisp

    CR: 2 (450 XP)
    AC: 19
    HP: (9d4)
    Speed: Walk 0 ft. Fly 50 ft. (hover)
    STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
    1 -5 28 +9 10 13 +2 14 +2 11 +1
    • Immunities: lightning and poison
    • Senses: darkvision 120 ft.
    • Alignment: Chaotic Evil
    • Languages: the languages it knew in life
    • Consume Life: As a bonus action, the will-o'-wisp can target one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a DC10 Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the will-o'-wisp regains 10 (3d6) hit points.
    • Ephemeral: The will-o'-wisp can't wear or carry anything.
    • Incorporeal Movement: The will-o'-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were TAG:quickref. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
    • Variable Illumination: The will-o'-wisp sheds bright light in a 5 to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of ft. equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.
    Actions
    • Shock: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Inflicts 9 (2d8) lightning damage.
    • Invisibility: The will-o'-wisp and its light magically become invisible until it attacks or uses its Consume Life, or until its TAG:status ends (as if TAG:status on a spell).
    • Monster Hoard:
      • 208 gp in coins
      • 550 gp worth of gemstones (50gp each): Sardonyx, 2 × Carnelian, Chalcedony, 2 × Star rose quartz, 2 × Moonstone, Citrine, 2 × Quartz
      • Magic Items: Potion of gaseous form, Potion of superior healing

  • There’s also a pile of papers in an alcove and some dried flowers next to it.

Torture Chamber > > Tomb of the Unspoken Skeletons > Area # 25

Foreshadowing
  • It is impossible to hear anything inside.
  • A successful listen roll will also reveal screams of fear coming from inside this area.
Doorways
  • S side - round iron door (Barricaded)
  • N side - rectangular wooden door (Half-broken)
  • W side - rectangular bronze door (Trapped)
    • There's a giant blade locked inside a cavity above the door. When undetected using a DC15 Wisdom (Perception, passive or active) check, it will trigger if stepping through an almost invisible trip wire. Succeed a DC20 Dexterity saving throw or sustain 1d8 damage.
  • E side - passage to area 18.
Description
Chains and shackles are fixtured all around and the walls are heavily weathered. A person is chained to the wall and you feel the chill of death curling up your spine.
  • Bazakor the Vampire is inside this area. It will attack anyone stepping in.

    Vampire

    CR: 13 (10000 XP)
    AC: 16 (natural armor)
    HP: (17d8 + 68)
    Speed: Walk 30 ft.
    STRDEXCONINTWISCHA
    18 +4 18 +4 18 +4 17 +4 15 +3 18 +4
    • Saving Throws: Dex +9, Wis +7, Cha +9
    • Senses: darkvision 120 ft.
    • Alignment: Lawful Evil
    • Languages: the languages it knew in life
    • Shapechanger: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form., While in bat form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies., While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.
    • Legendary Resistance (3/Day): If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
    • Misty Escape: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling unconscious, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed., While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.
    • Regeneration: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.
    • Spider Climb: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
    • Vampire Weaknesses: The vampire has the following flaws:, TAG:i The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants., TAG:i The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water., TAG:i If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is paralyzed until the stake is removed., TAG:i The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
    Actions
    • Multiattack (Vampire Form Only): The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.
    • Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only): +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Inflicts 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC18).
    • Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only): +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Inflicts 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a TAG:creature under the vampire's control.
    • Charm: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a DC17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be charmed by the vampire. The charmed target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack., Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.
    • Children of the Night (1/Day): The vampire magically calls 2d4 swarms of TAG:creature or TAG:creature, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, the vampire can call 3d6 TAG:creature instead. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.
    • Monster Hoard:
      • 28,000 gp in coins
      • 11,000 gp worth of gemstones (1000gp each): Fire opal, Opal, 2 × Star ruby, 2 × Blue sapphire, 4 × Emerald, Yellow sapphire
      • Magic Items: Scroll8th of Antimagic Field (Cleric, Wizard)

  • There’s also a small bell in a large basin and some small mounds of ashes next to it.
  • The chained person is Elspethria Verderosa’s daughter, Lysandra, from Dokar .
